worklogs.comment:
richardliaw commented on pull request #4850: ARROW-5560: [C++][Plasma] Cannot create Plasma object after OutOfMemory error
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4850
 
 
   If the client tries to call `CreateObject` and there is not enough memory left in the object store to create it, an `OutOfMemory` error will be returned. 
   
   However, the plasma store also creates an entry for the object, even though it failed to be created. This means that later on, if the client tries to create the object again, it will receive an error that the object already exists. Also, if the client tries to get the object, it will hang because the entry appears to be unsealed.
   
   We fix this by only creating the object entry if the `CreateObject` operation succeeds.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

stephanie-wang commented on pull request #4850: ARROW-5560: [C++][Plasma] Cannot create Plasma object after OutOfMemory error
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4850#discussion_r302305987
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/plasma/store.cc
 ##########
 @@ -259,6 +261,10 @@ PlasmaError PlasmaStore::CreateObject(const ObjectID& object_id, int64_t data_si
   entry->create_time = std::time(nullptr);
   entry->construct_duration = -1;
 
+#ifdef PLASMA_CUDA
+  entry->ipc_handle = ipc_handle;
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
     entry->ipc_handle = result->ipc_handle;
   ```
   Looks like `ipc_handle` wouldn't have been defined here.

pcmoritz commented on issue #4850: ARROW-5560: [C++][Plasma] Cannot create Plasma object after OutOfMemory error
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4850#issuecomment-511049800
 
 
   Do you want to come up with a small regression test that does the followin:
   
   - Start object store with small amount of memory
   - Create an object that is slightly larger than this memory, with a known object id
   - Have it fail
   - Try to recreate an object with the same id
   
   That would be helpful! You can look at `test_plasma.py` for examples on how these tests look like (and the regression test should also go in there).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

fields.description:
If the client tries to call `CreateObject` and there is not enough memory left in the object store to create it, an `OutOfMemory` error will be returned. However, the plasma store also creates an entry for the object, even though it failed to be created. This means that later on, if the client tries to create the object again, it will receive an error that the object already exists. Also, if the client tries to get the object, it will hang because the entry appears to be unsealed.

We should fix this by only creating the object entry if the `CreateObject` operation succeeds.
fields.summary: [C++][Plasma] Cannot create Plasma object after OutOfMemory error
